The district has informed all Red Oak High School families and staff of confirmed cases. The campus conducted contact tracing and has notified families of potential exposure. Any close contact identified individuals will be converted to full-time virtual students for the duration of their isolation or quarantine.

Reminder - stay home if you are sick or have any symptoms, have been exposed to someone with COVID (or someone with multiple symptoms and they are being tested), or if you are awaiting test results!
- wear a mask at all times in public
- social distance - 6 ft. apart

Together we can keep each other safe.
#hawkskeephawkssafe

shared_text:
Red Oak High School Alumni
September 15 at 2:54 PM ·

We are giving away a 55” Smart TV! Due to Covid-19, the Golden Reunion was cancelled, which meant our fundraising didn’t happen. However, we still awarded a $1000 scholarship to 2020 Senior Jarod Raack. Since a few raffle tickets had already been sold, we’ve decided to draw a winner to be announced during the Homecoming halftime on October 2. Tickets are only $1 each. Send your name and number by private message and we’ll reply with a Venmo pay option and photo of your tickets filled out! A virtual raffle! Thanks for helping the ROHS Alumni Association raise scholarship funds! Deadline for ticket purchase is October 1.

post_text: Save the Date for the FREE PSAT and SAT for Red Oak HS Juniors and Seniors.
shared_text:
Red Oak High School
Yesterday at 10:59 AM ·

Red Oak HS Juniors and Seniors!

WHAT: FREE PSAT/SAT School Day
When: Oct. 14 from 8:20 a.m. to 1 p.m.
Where: Red Oak High School

If a junior or senior is a face-to-face student, he/she has already been enrolled to take the PSAT (Juniors) or SAAT (Seniors) for FREE. They don’t need to do anything else but keep an eye out for communications for where to go and what to bring on the day of testing.

If a student is a virtual learner, he or she must come to campus to take the test. Check your email for directions or contact the school for information.
#hawksunite

post_text:
Red Oak High School is utilizing the Flippen Group program Capturing Kids Hearts to engage students daily in both academic and positive behavioral expectations.

Today's message - Capturing Kids Hearts:
"Believe in your dreams. Believe in today. Believe that you are loved. Believe that you make a difference. Believe we can build a
better world. Believe when others might not. Believe there's a light at the end of the tunnel. Believe that you might be that light
for someone else. Believe that the best is yet to be. Believe in each other. Believe in yourself. I believe in you." Kobi Yamada
#hawksunite #hawksbelieve

post_text:
Red Oak ISD - Red Oak Can!

💙💙Red Oak Can💙💙

Ellis County Can is an online challenge between all the cities of our great county. We're asking that city officials, business owners, teams, and coaches challenge each other to raise canned food for multiple pantries around the county. Collections will stay in the city that they are collected in to aid that area’s pantry. Collection sites will be posted over the weekend and collection dates are from September 14-18. We ask that this next week that we challenge each other. Let’s not only raise food for a great cause, but raise the hopes of all those in Ellis County. Help us wipe out hunger in Ellis County

Pantry needs are canned meats, chili, soup/stew, tuna, canned chicken, meals in a box, canned fruits/juices, peanut butter, jelly, powdered milk, beans, rice, canned drink mixes such as tea and lemonade, etc...

Sept. 14-18, 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. each day

Drop Off Locations:
Red Oak Public Works building
411 West Red Oak Road

Red Oak Police Department Administrative Annex
100 Bonham Court

#EllisCountyCan #RedOakCan

REACH Council
September 2 at 2:14 PM ·

Please join us for our free, 3 part series for families and community members. We will be tackling the topics of Critical Conversations with Youth, The Dangers of Vaping Nicotine and THC, and Rx Drug Safety/Disposal and Opioids.

Registration is free and there will be a drawing for an HEB gift card during each session.

To register, please go to http://www.bit.ly/TownHallSeriesReg or scan the QR code below.

post_text:
Tomorrow - Wednesday, Sept. 9 - is the first Colors for Caring day this year! Red Oak ISD began the Colors for Caring initiative to visibly show community support for loved ones who are battling against these medical conditions.

On the second Wednesday of each month in the 2020-21 school year, ROISD is encouraging the Hawk family and Hawk community to wear a color that represents one of these medical conditions that has affected the life of a loved one. Red Oak ISD students and staff may wear a t-shirt or polo shirt of the color they choose to support on these designated days.

Please visit http://bit.ly/2LzOqrd to see the designated Colors for Caring Days for the 2020-21 school year. Please know this is not an all-inclusive list of color awareness ribbons. Please visit Disable Word for a comprehensive list at http://bit.ly/2LBNzWZ.

The district has informed all Red Oak Middle School families and staff of a confirmed case. The campus conducted contact tracing and have notified families of potential exposure. Any close contact identified individuals will be converted to full-time virtual students for the duration of their isolation or quarantine.

While we still have a fairly low number of active case numbers in Ellis County (active cases 101), we can continue to reduce the spread with health and safety precautions.
- wear a mask at all times in public
- social distance - 6 ft. apart
- stay home if sick or symptoms

We appreciate the support of our families and know together we can keep each other safe.
#hawkskeephawkssafe

post_text:
The district has informed all Wooden Elementary families and staff of a confirmed student case. In addition, two secondary virtual learners (1 HS, 1 MS) who had been on campus for one class earlier in the week notified the district of a positive test result. The campuses conducted contact tracing and have notified families of potential exposure.

Any close contact identified students, along with the positive students, will be converted to full-time virtual students for the duration of their isolation or quarantine.

Reminder - we encourage all staff, students, and families to wear a mask or face covering in all public settings, frequently wash your hands, and limit your exposure to higher-risk situations such as eating out, team sports, or large gatherings. While we still have a fairly low number of active case numbers in Ellis County, we can continue to reduce the spread with health and safety precautions.

We appreciate the support of our families and know together we can keep each other safe.
#hawkskeephawkssafe

post_text:
Did you know attendance is taken in every course, every day for your virtual or face-to-face student?

Whether your student is attending school in-person or virtually, state education code mandates students must be present 90% of the days a course is offered to be awarded credit for the course and/or to be promoted to the next grade.

Also, truancy guidelines are still effective even if your student is learning in a virtual environment. Please encourage your student to engage every day in every course.

For additional information, please visit www.redoakisd.org and click on Return2Learn.
#HawksUnite

post_text: Following the sale of the Live Oak complex to the City of Red Oak, the district had to find a new home for maintenance and ground vehicles and storage. The decision was made to transform the current ag barn and area into that storage, and create a new ROISD Ag Project Center for the students and their animals on existing district land off Bells Chapel (behind the transportation/bus facility). Over the past nine months, that project has been under construction with completion expected later this fall. Stay tuned for more photos and a grand opening (fingers crossed).

post_text:
ROISD had its first confirmed student cases yesterday - two family members at ROHS and ROMS. All individuals were asymptotic- parent was tested at work in the am - rapid test - which was positive and notified schools. Students were isolated and left the school to be tested and two were positive. Truly parents did exactly what they were supposed to do and we thank them for their quick response. All families and staff at both campuses were notified yesterday afternoon once the family notified the school. Campus staff are conducting contact tracing and will reach out privately to any impacted students and staff.
ROISD Communications

post_text:
We are excited about the first day of school tomorrow and want to share a couple of reminders about health and safety for our in-person learners.
Parents, please review the video below with your students, especially younger children, to remind them of safety measures at the school.

Remember:
- Self-screen or parent-screen for younger children and DO NOT come to
school if you are sick, have symptoms listed online, or have had recent
contact with an individual who has COVID. Please follow Return 2 School
guidelines online.
- Masks required for all on buses and in school common areas; PreK-3
may remove their mask when at their desk working on their own.
- Stay 6 ft. apart in hallways and common areas.
- Air hugs and air high-fives for your teachers and friends!
- Have a great first day!

See you all tomorrow - whether here or there! #HawksUnite

post_text:
For our At-Home Virtual Learners, healthy and delicious meals will be available by weekly curbside service. Distribution sites for the first semester will be Red Oak Middle School, Eastridge Elementary, and Shields Elementary. Distribution times will be from 11:30 a.m. – 12:00 noon.

The packaged meals will be distributed in a drive-thru fashion on Mondays and Thursdays beginning Thursday, August 20. Monday meal bundles will include three breakfast meals and three lunch meals. Thursday meal bundles will include two breakfast meals and two lunch meals. Each meal will come with a choice of milk. One of the meals each serving day will be prepared and served hot, and the remaining meals will be cold or shelf-stable meals. Meals are available for Red Oak ISD enrolled students only.

For more information and pricing, visit redoakisd.org/return2learn

post_text:
Red Oak ISD Superintendent Brenda Sanford swore in new ROISD Police Chief Phillip Prasifka on August 17, 2020. Prasifka, formerly with the City of Glenn Heights for 18 years, was joined by his wife, three children who are ROHS graduates, and his parents. The oath includes the affirmation to execute the duties of the office and to the best of one’s ability to preserve, protect, and defend the Constitution and laws of the United States and Texas.

Chief Phillip Prasifka has over 35 years of law enforcement experience, most recently as the Police Chief in Robinson, TX. He will oversee the campus-based officers and dispatch, as well as crisis management, emergency operations, and officer relations programs.
text:
Red Oak ISD Superintendent Brenda Sanford swore in new ROISD Police Chief Phillip Prasifka on August 17, 2020. Prasifka, formerly with the City of Glenn Heights for 18 years, was joined by his wife, three children who are ROHS graduates, and his parents. The oath includes the affirmation to execute the duties of the office and to the best of one’s ability to preserve, protect, and defend the Constitution and laws of the United States and Texas.

Chief Phillip Prasifka has over 35 years of law enforcement experience, most recently as the Police Chief in Robinson, TX. He will oversee the campus-based officers and dispatch, as well as crisis management, emergency operations, and officer relations programs.

post_text:
Today at 10 a.m. ALL Red Oak ISD teachers will hear from Dr. Barbara Oakley - co-creator of the Learning How To Learn a world-renowned massive open online course (MOOC), and other books and classes. In addition, Professor Oakley participates in several areas of research. These include STEM education, engineering education, general learning, online learning, MOOCs and their effects, and studies of empathy and altruism.

She will be doing a district-wide video training conference on August 13, 10:00-12:00. Her focus will be on learning from her soon to be published book: Uncommon Sense Teaching: Practical Insights from Neuroscience to Help You in the Classroom, and how to create compelling engaging materials for on-line learning.

https://barbaraoakley.com/

post_text:
REMINDER - Shot Clinic TODAY

Red Oak ISD is hosting an immunization clinic TODAY - Monday, August 10 - from 3-6 p.m. at the ROISD CTE Building located at 156 Louise Ritter Blvd. Bldg 2.

All ROISD students age 3-18 are welcome to attend – one parent or guardian (only one per student) MUST be present. A paper PRINTED current vaccine record or note from the school stating missing vaccines is required. Social distancing will be marked and masks/face covering are required.

Please bring your insurance card or Medicaid/CHIP card. Aetna, Blue Cross Blue Shield, Cigna, Humana, and United Health Care PPO plans will be accepted. There will be no charge for Medicaid/CHIP members. The uninsured rate will be $10 per vaccine ($40 max. per child). Please bring CASH or check for payment.

More details at www.redoakisd.org
text:
REMINDER - Shot Clinic TODAY

Red Oak ISD is hosting an immunization clinic TODAY - Monday, August 10 - from 3-6 p.m. at the ROISD CTE Building located at 156 Louise Ritter Blvd. Bldg 2.

All ROISD students age 3-18 are welcome to attend – one parent or guardian (only one per student) MUST be present. A paper PRINTED current vaccine record or note from the school stating missing vaccines is required. Social distancing will be marked and masks/face covering are required.

Please bring your insurance card or Medicaid/CHIP card. Aetna, Blue Cross Blue Shield, Cigna, Humana, and United Health Care PPO plans will be accepted. There will be no charge for Medicaid/CHIP members. The uninsured rate will be $10 per vaccine ($40 max. per child). Please bring CASH or check for payment.

More details at www.redoakisd.org

post_text: ROMS Updates
shared_text:
Red Oak Middle School
August 4 at 4:54 PM ·

ROMS Schedules:

Schedules will be posted in SKYWARD by August 17 for students who are completely registered. If you need assistance with registration, you may contact the ROHS PEIMS office.

Steps to get my schedule:
- Complete Online Registration
- Select Instructional Method in Skyward - in-person or online
- Submit my Proof of Residency (POR)
- Submit my immunization records - note: 7th graders need updated Tdap and Meningococcal vaccines; send shot records to the nurse - christina.helms@redoakisd.org

Once you receive your schedule review it! If you have a problem with your schedule after you receive it, then you may call the counselor for assistance. If you receive your schedule from Skyward, in-person schedule pick-up IS NOT NECESSARY.

ROMS In-Person Schedule Pick-Up and Document Drop-Off:
Monday, August 17 - 6th graders at 6th Grade Center, 7-8th graders at ROMS Main Campus
- A-L from 8 a.m. to noon
- M-Z from 1-4 p.m.
- Make-Up times from 4-7 p.m.

post_text:
ROISD Special Board Meeting on Friday, July 31 at 8 p.m.

Individuals wishing to attend: the Board Meeting will be held in the Board Room with safety measures and social distancing protocols which will limit capacity. We will have overflow rooms available if needed that will have the meeting streaming as well. Face coverings are required for all attendees and seats are pre-set 6 ft. apart.

Individuals wishing to speak: please review the Open Forum Policy on the website. You may either bring a completed sign-up form or complete one onsite. Forms must be submitted prior to the posted meeting start time.

Link for LIVE meeting - https://youtu.be/mvVaScPK8uI

post_text:
ROISD Parents - ALL students enrolled in Red Oak ISD schools MUST have current immunizations on file by the first day of school, regardless of if the student is learning in-person or at-home/virtually. There is NOT a state waiver for at-home learners to not have current shot records on file with the campus. The district is trying to set-up a shot clinic between now and the start of school and we hope to share that soon.

Immunizations - https://www.redoakisd.org/Page/2068

Athletic / UIL Physicals - if your student has a physical on file from last year and has not had any medical changes, they DO NOT have to have a new physical this year. If your student is NEW to the ISD, had a medical change or new to athletics / UIL activities (7th graders), they need to have a current physical on file PRIOR to participation.

Physical Forms - https://www.redoakisd.org/domain/2325

post_text:
Thank you so much for those families who have already selected the preferred instructional method for their children. This valuable information will assist the district in finalizing plans for both in-person and virtual instructional models including technology needs, staffing assignments, facility use, and much more.

If you have not yet, please take a moment by 8 a.m. on Monday, August 3 to decide which instructional method for each student and complete the SKYWARD email survey.

Regardless of your 'method of instruction' selection, EVERY student must complete the returning student registration (or new student registration/enrollment if new to ROISD) to be a student in ROISD.

Please click here for Student Registration
(https://www.redoakisd.org/back2school)

The completion of the SKYWARD instruction selection IS NOT registration for school.

In an effort to mitigate the spread of COVID-19 in our community, ROISD will suspend all on-campus student activities for the weeks of July 27 and August 3. On-campus activities will be scheduled to resume on Monday, August 10.

This suspension of activities includes all strength and conditioning activities, sports camps, club meetings, and fine arts practices.

Please check the ROISD website for additional updates regarding on-campus student activities.

Due to gathering size limitations because of COVID, we are cancelling the annual ROISD Back to School / Health Fair. We know many families rely on this resource to help prepare students for school and will provide services as able.

We are working with our immunization provider to hopefully offer an appointment shot clinic. Hearing and vision screenings will take place on campus during the fall.

Distribution of uniforms, backpacks and supplies will take place for families in need by appointment ONLY with our School and Family Services Department - appt. scheduling will open July 27. Donations are accepted at the Administration Building for those wishing to assist our families.

We thank our community for your annual support and our families for their patience.

post_text:
Red Oak ISD is currently enrolling Pre-K students for the 2020-2021 school year. Red Oak ISD plans to offer both full-day and half-day Pre-K, to qualified students, in both English and Spanish. If you wish to be considered for the lottery, you must be enrolled and qualified for Pre-K BEFORE 3:30 on THURSDAY, JULY 23rd. While we will attempt to place all half-day students in their neighborhood school, the Pre-K program will overflow to other campuses based on numbers, on a first-come-first-served basis. Please enroll online at New Student Enrollment. If you need assistance with the on-line enrollment system for Pre-K, we are currently scheduling appointments for JULY 20th and 21st. Appointments will be held by appointment ONLY due to Coronavirus restrictions. Please call Becky Waller at 972-617-2941 to schedule an appointment.

For more information regarding Pre-K, please see our website https://www.redoakisd.org/Page/2028.

The Texas Education Agency (TEA) released more specific guidance on Tuesday, July 7 about the health and safety protocols for the reopening of schools for fall 2020. Red Oak ISD administrators are currently reviewing that guidance and will be creating a more in-depth plan for in-person learning and virtual learning, which will be shared with the community soon.

For district updates, please visit www.redoakisd.org and click on the Education Migration 2020 page at the top right.

In particular updates about in-person public health orders and the Instructional Continuity Planning (Strong Start) have been updated.
https://tea.texas.gov/texas-schools/health-safety-discipline/covid/coronavirus-covid-19-support-and-guidance

post_text:
Administrative Announcement:

Red Oak ISD Police Chief Kevin Denney recently announced his resignation to pursue other opportunities, including but not limited to pursuing his Ph.D. in Criminal Justice. During his tenure at Red Oak ISD, Chief Denney led the introduction of the current safety system and implemented new programs, including Students Working As A Team (SWAAT), the women's self-defense classes (RAD), mentorship initiatives, and the District student assessment groups. We wish Chief Denney the very best as he pursues these opportunities.

Red Oak ISD has initiated the search for a new Police Chief by posting the position for applications. During this search and process, ROISD is placing Sgt. Lori Guarnero in the capacity of Interim ROISD Police Chief. Our goal for the ROISD Police Department is to maintain a high level of knowledge, skill, ability, and integrity as each and every officer develops positive relationships with the students, staff, and community.
text:
Administrative Announcement:

Red Oak ISD Police Chief Kevin Denney recently announced his resignation to pursue other opportunities, including but not limited to pursuing his Ph.D. in Criminal Justice. During his tenure at Red Oak ISD, Chief Denney led the introduction of the current safety system and implemented new programs, including Students Working As A Team (SWAAT), the women's self-defense classes (RAD), mentorship initiatives, and the District student assessment groups. We wish Chief Denney the very best as he pursues these opportunities.

Red Oak ISD has initiated the search for a new Police Chief by posting the position for applications. During this search and process, ROISD is placing Sgt. Lori Guarnero in the capacity of Interim ROISD Police Chief. Our goal for the ROISD Police Department is to maintain a high level of knowledge, skill, ability, and integrity as each and every officer develops positive relationships with the students, staff, and community.

post_text:
Red Oak ISD is continuing to develop safety plans for in-person instruction and plans for virtual/remote learning for those families who prefer to remain at home.

TEA has again delayed official requirements/guidelines, but we continue to prepare for both in-person and virtual learning by adjusting the calendar for breaks if needed, increasing our device count, researching hotspots and WIFI options, reviewing staffing and curriculum options, and much more.

Based on the state allotment of personal protective equipment (PPE), Red Oak ISD will receive 55,080 disposable masks, 13,770 reusable masks, 27,812 gloves, 45 thermometers, 648 gallons of hand sanitizer, and 818 adult face shields to use for student and staff protection.

"The safety of our students, and staff, is the priority," stated Superintendent Brenda Sanford. "We will be offering varied instructional methods to meet our family needs."

shared_text:
Red Oak High School
June 2 at 10:27 AM ·

Good morning ROHS Class of 2020 Graduates (and parents),

We hope you enjoyed the event at Globe Life Field on Sunday and we will be sending additional information out about the FREE 8x10 that will be mailed to you and available photo packages from the photographer soon.

Due to the layout at Globe Life Field and social distancing, we were not able to have the time-honored tradition of Board Members handing out diplomas at the ceremony.

Instead, we will be hosting a special second photo opportunity for our graduates TONIGHT - Tuesday, June 2 - from 6-7 p.m. in the Red Oak High School Cafeteria to have your photo taken with the full School Board or an individual Board member of your choosing. These photos will also be mailed to you.

Please wear your cap and gown and bring your diploma cover. We will take students first-come, first-served.

See you tonight!

post_text:
Because of school closures from COVID-19, Texas received approval from the U.S. Department of Agriculture to provide more than $1 billion in pandemic food benefits to families with children that have temporarily lost access to free or reduced-price school meals.

Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT) provides eligible families with a one-time payment for each child who previously received free or reduced-price meals. P-EBT works the same way Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) benefits do and will help families get the food they need during the current pandemic. P-EBT will be administered by the Texas Health and Human Services Commission, Texas Department of Agriculture and Texas Education Agency.

Visit the Student Nutrition Department page on Redoakisd.org for local details.
text:

P-EBT works the same way Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) benefits do and will help families get the food they need during the current pandemic. P-EBT will be administered by the Texas Health and Human Services Commission, Texas Department of Agriculture and Texas Education Agency.

post_text:
CLASS OF 2020 GRADUATION UPDATE

We are very excited about your special graduation at Globe Life Field on Sunday, May 31. We have secured the 2:30 p.m. time slot that day.

We are continuing to work through details on social distancing with stadium personnel before announcing the number of tickets allotted to each grad. We can share that there will not be a charge for parking during graduation, but the stadium bag policy will be in effect.

We are planning a Graduate Pick-Up day later in May to include programs, transcripts, tickets, instructions, and other items and will send that information as soon as the date and time are decided.

More details at https://www.redoakisd.org/site/default.aspx?PageID=4341

post_text:
Red Oak High School administrators surprised the Class of 2020 Valedictorian and Salutatorian this morning with a house visit!

Valedictorian Julie Zahrndt
A Hawk Scholar and AP Scholar with Honor, Julie is also a member of Phi Theta Kappa Honor Society and the President of NHS. A trumpet player in the Hawk Band, she earned All-State honors and is a member of the Dallas Symphony Orchestra Teen Council. She plans to earn dual degrees in Music Performance and Music Appreciation at SMU.

Salutatorian Caleb Mullins
A Hawk Scholar as well as UIL Academic and A Honor Roll, Caleb has also been active as a Church Camp Counselor. He will be attending Texas A&M University at College Station to earn degrees in Physics and Math toward his career as a physicist.

Congratulations to the Class of 2020 Valedictorian and Salutatorian!

post_text:
WOW - what an amazing three days of serving ALL ROISD employees breakfast at the Red Oak Chick-fil-A. Special thanks to all our admin. 'cheerleaders' and the Hawk mascot for joining us every day, and the amazing team at Chick-fil-A and the Cow!

We love and miss our staff (and students!) and appreciate all the hard work being done at home to continue serving our students with instruction delivery, meal distribution, tech support, and so much more! Keep up the great work!

#HawksatHome #ROstrong #4talons

post_text: North Texas Giving Tuesday is happening NOW! There are several local organizations that could use your support including the ROISD Education Foundation. Click the link below to donate today!
shared_text:
NORTHTEXASGIVINGDAY.ORG
#NTxGivingTuesdayNow

Red Oak ISD Education Foundation
May 5 at 8:00 AM ·

Today is the day! Today, our community will come together for North Texas Giving Tuesday Now, an emergency giving day
to support the nonprofits in our region. As you know, many nonprofits have been challenged by the current climate and the impact of COVID-19 on our community, region and world.
If you can, we’re asking for your support on this emergency giving day, to help organizations in our community continue their work, serving those who rely on their services and providing resources for their staff and volunteers to continue forging ahead.

There are several local organizations that could use your support including the ROISD Education Foundation. You can filter organizations right here in Red Oak!
https://www.northtexasgivingday.org/nonprofits to search a non profit to support or support the ROISD Education Foundation here: https://www.northtexasgivingday.org/red-oak-isd-education-f…

#NTxGivingTuesdayNow

In addition to Teacher Appreciation Week, it's also National Substitute Week! At Red Oak ISD, we know the importance of having exceptional substitute team members. Substitutes are amazing individuals who step into the classroom to ensure quality teaching continues when a teacher is out sick, on business, or in training.

Thank you, Red Oak ISD substitutes, for ensuring our students continued learning and success!

shared_text:
Teachers Can
May 3 at 9:04 PM ·

Thirty nine events — that's what we have planned to honor teachers during this Teacher Appreciation Week. All of the events will be livestreamed at TeachersCan.org/events, unless indicated otherwise there. And get some sleep , because your schedule of events starts at 7:30 each morning, including tomorrow. You don't have to be a teacher to participate, but we are doing this specifically to pay tribute to our awesome Texas teachers.

Which event(s) are you most looking forward to?

#TeachersCan #ThankATeacher

post_text:
Today, Red Oak ISD had the opportunity to be a part of welcoming home one of our Hawks! Red Oak Middle School student, Angel Tovar had a surprise parade to welcome him home from the hospital. In April, his brother Joan, a third-grader at Red Oak Elementary, donated his bone marrow to help his brother fight leukemia. The transplant has been successful and Angel's white blood cell count has skyrocketed since the transplant.

Thank you to our local fireman, police officers, teachers, staff, and friends for making this drive-by parade so special!

The transplant has been successful and Angel's white blood cell count has skyrocketed since the transplant.

Thank you to our local fireman, police officers, teachers, staff, and friends for making this drive-by parade so special!

post_text:
Congratulations to your Red Oak High School Yearbook staff and advisor Mallory Lozoya - the 2019 yearbook has been designated an Honorable Mention in Balfour's Yearbook Yearbook. This annual Yearbook of winners showcases exceptional work in theme development, design, and photography from publications across the US and overseas.

“This is a huge honor for our staff! The students have worked so hard to improve each year, and I am so proud of what they've accomplished!” Exclaimed Lozoya. “I know we can't congratulate the kids right now in person, but I wanted them to be recognized.”

Thank you for your support of the yearbook program!
text:

“This is a huge honor for our staff! The students have worked so hard to improve each year, and I am so proud of what they've accomplished!” Exclaimed Lozoya. “I know we can't congratulate the kids right now in person, but I wanted them to be recognized.”

Is there a teacher you should have thanked, for believing in you, for inspiring you to greater heights, for challenging you to take that extra step? It's not too late. We want to hear your stories and created these prompts to help get you started. Use your phone, tablet, or computer to record a video about that teacher and upload it to Facebook, Instagram, or Twitter using the hashtags #TeachersCan and #ThankATeacher.

post_text:
ROISD Teachers - Record a short video about why you teach, what you wish others knew about teaching, and/or how teachers make a big difference for others. You can win prizes from TeachersCan!
Then upload it to your Facebook, Twitter, and/or Instagram account using the hashtag #TeachersCan.
shared_text:
Teachers Can
April 13 at 5:32 PM ·

Teachers, your voice matters more now than ever. We have seen on social media how much you miss your students, how hard you've been working to connect with them, and how desperately you want to be back in the classroom. We see how much you love teaching, and we would love to hear your stories.

Record a short video about why you teach, what you wish others knew about teaching, and/or how teachers make a big difference for others. Then upload it to your Facebook, Twitter, and/or Instagram account using the hashtag #TeachersCan. Use the following prompts to help get you started.

post_text:
Hey Hawk Seniors:

I was so excited to see your pictures with your Senior 2020 signs yesterday. I am so glad that you liked them! We miss seeing your smiling faces on campus!

I know your graduation ceremony is on your minds continually. Please know that it is at the forefront of mine and the School Board’s minds as well. We are awaiting guidance from the Commissioner of Education, and then we will continue looking at how to create a graduation ceremony that is fit for the amazing Red Oak High School Class of 2020!

We will keep you posted as we know more, but again, rest assured we will hold a ceremony that will honor you!

Sincerely,
Brenda Sanford
Superintendent, Red Oak ISD

post_text:
Based on an extension of the Executive Order by Texas Governor Abbott, Red Oak ISD campuses will remain closed to students while providing online instruction through the remainder of the school year - Friday, May 22, 2020.

The district has modified the grading policy for the spring 2020 semester. We know that online distant learning is not ideal for all learning, so we have made changes that will provide a balanced grading system for students to succeed. Yes, we are still taking grades for assignments and will continue educating our children each and every day. Please review the full changes and FAQ on the district website under COVID19.

This semester looks like this for grading:
4th 6 weeks - 45%
5th 6 weeks - 45% (with extended grade input window to complete assignments)
6th 6 weeks - 10%
No final exams

See the full letter from Superintendent Brenda Sanford on the website.

No final exams

See the full letter from Superintendent Brenda Sanford on the website.

post_text:
Red Oak ISD revises grading policies for spring 2020

The State response to the dangers of the COVID-19 disease has required ROISD to respond with revisions to its grading policies. The following is a revision to the ROISD grading policies for the second semester of the 2019-2020 school year and subject to change based upon further State action.

The goal is to maintain as much consistency as practical and to align with federal, state, and district laws and policies as closely as practical with the minimum number of revisions.
• The ROISD grading manual has been suspended for the second semester due to COVID-19.
• 5th-six weeks report cards will be issued on May 1. Please check your Skyward account.
• Full policy change available at https://www.redoakisd.org/Page/4413

Red Oak ISD revises grading policies for spring 2020

The goal is to maintain as much consistency as practical and to align with federal, state, and district laws and policies as closely as practical with the minimum number of revisions.
• The ROISD grading manual has been suspended for the second semester due to COVID-19.
• 5th-six weeks report cards will be issued on May 1. Please check your Skyward account.
• Full policy change available at https://www.redoakisd.org/Page/4413

post_text:
#TEACHERSCAN
"The very reason teachers choose their profession — their desire to put their students before themselves — also precludes them from taking credit for the lifelong difference they make for those students. If this point in time has revealed anything, it is just how incredible and important teachers are."

Teachers Can is a partnership of businesses, associations, community organizations, and universities who believe that, now more than ever, teachers deserve to own their impact and be recognized for all they do. We think you'll agree that teachers deserve to hear from all of us how valuable they are to our students, our families, our communities, and our future.

Visit TeachersCan.org to find more ways to thank our teachers.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a9yeTriG9V4

post_text:
While we are remote/distant learning during the coronavirus concerns, we want to celebrate, now more than ever, our amazing Red Oak ISD parents with our annual Parent of the Year awards.

“The event was canceled, but it is vital to honor these moms and dads who were nominated by their children,” stated Superintendent Brenda Sanford. “The nomination letters were touching, heart-warming, emotional, and full of love. We couldn’t be prouder of our students and their outstanding parent nominees.”

“To our parents, ROISD is an amazing district because of your caring attitude, love of your children and support of their education. We can’t do it without you! exclaimed Sanford. “We also want to thank our students for all their amazing entries – showering their parents with love and appreciation. Finally, thanks to the staff and campus administration for facilitating the process, and Mrs. Donna Knight for spearheading this amazing award program. We celebrate each of the winners.”

On behalf of the Board, district and campus administration, congratulations!

www.youtube.com/watch?v=tlMF5zAG5IE

Practice Social Distancing

To avoid the spread of COVID-19 in our community, practice social distancing:
• Avoid going out in public
• When in public, keep six feet of distance between you and others
• Follow the guidance provided by local and state officials.
Get more information at https://texas.gov/covid19
#covid19 #texasstrong #stayhome

Para prevenir la propagación de COVID-19 en nuestra comunidad, practique el distanciamiento social:
• Evite salir en público

• Seguir las recomendaciones de los funcionarios locales y estatales.

April is National School Library Month. At Red Oak ISD, the Learning Commons goes beyond a traditional library! Imagine a space designed to engage today’s students. By combining new technologies available in this digital age with our print resource collections, we connect with others locally and globally, read for enjoyment and knowledge, and learn about our world!

As our Learning Commons are temporarily closed, our amazing Librarians want to remind our students that the digital library is always open! Red Oak ISD students can sign into soraapp.com with their school credentials and have access to endless Ebooks!

post_text:
We are so grateful to have such amazing resources, awesome staff, and gracious families today, and every day!

Thanks to our tech team for setting up device check-out for families today. The line was from the front of the high school, down the driveway and to the street before we even started at 1 p.m. But everyone was polite, patient, and gracious as they receive a laptop (165 in the first 2 hours) for use during this unprecedented time.

Online curriculum launched today with grade-level instruction for elementary schools and Naviance activities for secondary, their content will start March 30.

For additional information, visit www.redoakisd.org/COVID19

Tomorrow starts online learning and meal distribution in Red Oak ISD! We miss our students, staff, and Hawk families - but are ready to serve you in this new, temporary venture! We thank each of our staff members - mostly working from home - for their preparation and passion to continue serving our community. In advance, we thank you for your patience during this time - it’s new to us too - and please observe our social distancing measures, including no student access to campuses.

Keep posting your awesome #HawksatHome pics and join in the spirit week fun!

For updates, follow your campus social media pages or visit our website www.redoakisd.org, or email info@redoakisd.org if you need any type of assistance.

post_text:
Texas Gov. Abbott has announced an executive order following a public health disaster.

- All Texas schools temporarily closed until April 3 but remote learning should take place through your local district
- No gatherings of more than 10 people
- No eating/drinking at bars/restaurants, takeout/drive-thru OK, gyms, theaters, etc. closed
- No visiting nursing/retirement homes, except for critical care
- Government and businesses encouraged to have only essential personnel on hand, others can telecommute if able

The order goes into effect at midnight March 20 through April 3.
text:
Texas Gov. Abbott has announced an executive order following a public health disaster.

- All Texas schools temporarily closed until April 3 but remote learning should take place through your local district
- No gatherings of more than 10 people
- No eating/drinking at bars/restaurants, takeout/drive-thru OK, gyms, theaters, etc. closed
- No visiting nursing/retirement homes, except for critical care
- Government and businesses encouraged to have only essential personnel on hand, others can telecommute if able

The order goes into effect at midnight March 20 through April 3.

Wednesday, March 18 from 6-8 p.m. several community groups will be providing food bags for families. Drive-thru pickup will be at First Baptist Red Oak, 320 E. Ovilla Rd. on a first-come, first-served basis. Food items include peanut butter, jelly, crackers, cereal and more.

• Red Oak Middle School – 154 Louise Ritter Blvd.

post_text:
Dear ROISD Families:

In an effort to update you on the latest COVID-19 situation, Red Oak ISD will meet with the Ellis County area health agencies later this morning, as well as with our Texas Education Agency Commissioner Mike Morath this afternoon. Based on these meetings, we will make a decision about the possible extension of spring break. Many area school districts are continuing to make spring break extension announcements as they meet with their local health agencies. These school closure decisions are based on these health agency recommendations.

As you may know, information is rapidly changing and we are continuously monitoring and assessing the situation. Thank you for your patience and understanding during this time.

Dear ROISD Families:

In an effort to update you on the latest COVID-19 situation, Red Oak ISD will meet with the Ellis County area health agencies later this morning, as well as with our Texas Education Agency Commissioner Mike Morath this afternoon. Based on these meetings, we will make a decision about the possible extension of spring break. Many area school districts are continuing to make spring break extension announcements as they meet with their local health agencies. These school closure decisions are based on these health agency recommendations.

As you may know, information is rapidly changing and we are continuously monitoring and assessing the situation. Thank you for your patience and understanding during this time.

post_text: What an accomplishment! Great job ROMS choirs.
shared_text:
Red Oak Middle School
March 3 at 10:21 AM ·

ROMS Varsity Choirs recently sang in the UIL Concert and Sight-Reading Contest and both Choirs came home with Sweepstakes awards and Superior ratings in both their Concert and Sight-Reading!

This is the fourth year in a row that the Varsity women have come home with this award. For the men, this is their first time going as a Varsity Choir in the history of Red Oak Middle School! If you see these kids, please congratulate them on their hard work. We are so proud of you!

post_text:
The Lady Hawks Basketball Team will play against Frisco Liberty High School in the regional semifinal round of playoffs on Friday, February 28 at the Curtis Culwell Center at 7:30 PM.

Ticket prices will be $6 for students and $8 for adults.

Tickets may be purchased online at
https://www.curtisculwellcenter.com/content/uil-girls-5a-regional-basketball-tournament-1.

No passes will be accepted for the regional tournament.
JV Teams will not be permitted for free.

Spectators will be charged $10 cash per car to park.

Curtis Culwell Center Regulations

Signs, megaphones, large flags, banners, band instruments, horns, mechanical noisemakers, confetti, and live animals will not be allowed in the C.C.C. Bands will not be permitted to play and there will be no half time performances by anyone at the regional tournament.

Outside food and drinks are not allowed inside the Curtis Culwell Center.

post_text: Congrats to our Red Oak HS STUCO on their awards!
shared_text:
Red Oak High School Student Council
February 22 at 8:03 PM ·

We have exciting news!
First—Our council attended the Texas Association of Student Councils District 3 Spring Conference at Northwest HS today and we were elected the D3 President!!!
We performed a campaign skit and passed out campaign materials about our platform on childhood literacy. We are honored to represent the almost 200 councils of the DFW area! Mia Hernandez will serve as our representative.

Second—two of our members received scholarships to attend TASC Summer Workshops! Congratulations Aliyah Easterling and Natalie Rodriguez!

Finally—We were recognized as a Sweepstakes and Outstanding council—meaning we have completed an exceptional number of projects in the categories of DASH ( drugs, alcohol, safety, health), Pride and Patriotism, Energy and Environment, and Community Service.

Thank you to all our hard working officers, members, and advisors who contributed to this success!

*we will try to post our campaign skit in a separate post
text:
Congrats to our Red Oak HS STUCO on their awards!

Red Oak High School Student Council
February 22 at 8:03 PM ·

We have exciting news!
First—Our council attended the Texas Association of Student Councils District 3 Spring Conference at Northwest HS today and we were elected the D3 President!!!
We performed a campaign skit and passed out campaign materials about our platform on childhood literacy. We are honored to represent the almost 200 councils of the DFW area! Mia Hernandez will serve as our representative.

Second—two of our members received scholarships to attend TASC Summer Workshops! Congratulations Aliyah Easterling and Natalie Rodriguez!

Finally—We were recognized as a Sweepstakes and Outstanding council—meaning we have completed an exceptional number of projects in the categories of DASH ( drugs, alcohol, safety, health), Pride and Patriotism, Energy and Environment, and Community Service.

Thank you to all our hard working officers, members, and advisors who contributed to this success!

*we will try to post our campaign skit in a separate post

post_text:
Hawk family,

Red Oak HS Head Football Coach Chris Ross has informed the district of his intention to accept a position with another district. Pending that district’s Board approval, Red Oak ISD intends to offer current assistant coach Michael Quintero the new Red Oak HS Head Football Coach position.

“We thank Coach Ross for his service to the Hawk Family over the past two years,” stated Athletics Director Chris Anderson. “We look forward to continuing the success of the program with our outstanding student-athletes and staff under the leadership of Coach Q. Consistency will be important as we go forward.”

The Red Oak Hawk Football Team finished the 2019-20 season 11-2. They were undefeated district champions and advanced to the third round of the playoffs before a loss to eventual state champions Aledo HS.

ROISD Communications

Consistency will be important as we go forward.”

post_text: Congratulations to Red Oak ISD alum Michelle Carter on her Texas Sports Hall of Fame Induction AND good luck at the meet this weekend en route to the Summer Olympics!
shared_text:
Michelle Carter
February 8 at 10:02 AM ·

When I tell you it all still feels like a dream. I'm for real. It still feels like a dream.

I am getting inducted into the State of Texas Hall of Fame March 28, 2020. My Dad was inducted in 2002 and I remember going to his ceremony thinking how cool is this. Now it's my turn. We have talents, gifts, dreams, and goals and we don't know how they are going to manifest. I knew I could win the Olympics but I didn't know what was going to happen after that. I have been able to touch so many lives. The young and the experienced, black, brown, white and all the colors in between. Those who have a lot and those who don't have enough. Throwing the shot put has allowed me so many opportunities to encourage others. God gave me this gift that's not popular but it's effective and I'm so grateful! More information to come.
#Legacy #History #Texas #HallOfFame #ShotDiva #ShotPut #TrackAndField #USATF #Blessed #Grateful #Grace

post_text:
It's National School Counseling Week!

“Counselors work hand-in-hand with staff and administration to provide services to students including student course selection and academic decisions, college and career guidance, conflict management, planning action steps towards goals, and much more. A counselor can be the oil to the wheel of unique student needs, diverse staff and student populations, and even parent to school relationships. We value and appreciate our wonderful school counselors for all they do for our students,” stated Red Oak ISD Superintendent Brenda Sanford.

Be sure to thank your school counselor this week!

post_text:
Did you know Red Oak High School offers Forensic Science courses? Students recently learned about questioned documents. Students searched, observed, and described the security features (seals, signatures, and images) on U.S. currency and identified hidden images using magnifying glasses and UV light. Students also learned procedures that a document examiner working for the U.S. Secret Service would look for in identifying a real vs. counterfeit bill. Red Oak ISD is equipping students for the future! #CTEMonth

For more information about the CTE programs offered at ROISD, visit https://www.redoakisd.org/Page/1940.

February is Career and Technical Education month! CTE encompasses many different types of education, from classroom learning to certification programs, to work-based learning opportunities outside the classroom. With over 111 Career and Technology courses offered at ROHS, Red Oak ISD is proud of the opportunities CTE provides for our students and the doors it continues to open.

Visit our website to learn more about the CTE courses we offer at https://www.redoakisd.org/Page/1940.

post_text:
Eclipsing a milestone doesn’t mean you have reached the top, but it is worth the recognition that you are on a solid path!

Red Oak HS has two ladies that are at or near a milestone, or two, that we recognized tonight.

First, sophomore point-guard Breanna Davis. Breanna is a two-year varsity player and captain this year who recently reached the 1,000 high school career point milestone. She is averaging over 15 points per game along with substantial numbers in steals, assists and rebounds. Congratulations Breanna.

Next, junior forward Aniyah Johnson. Aniyah is a three-year varsity player and captain who has already reached the 1,000 high school career rebound mark and will very soon reach the 1,000 career point mark. She averages just under 10 points per game, and 9 rebounds per game this year, along with 3 blocks per game. Congratulations Aniyah.

These young ladies and their teammates have worked hard to accomplish this feat

post_text: Congratulations to Red Oak HS senior trumpeter Julie Zahrndt on her selection as the 2020-21 TMEA Bill Cormack Undergrad Scholarship recipient - valued at $15,000! The scholarship, the largest of TMEA's $225,000 this year, is named for past executive director Bill Cormack, who had a passion for music and was compelled to share it with schoolchildren in our state. Julie, who recently earned 1st Chair All-State, was selected from a group of over 100 candidates. #seekopportunities #4talons

Hey Hawks,

Red Oak ISD values the safety and security of all students, staff, and guests at all our events.

In light of recent issues, this is a reminder that all Red Oak ISD students must have their ID on and visible at all sporting events, concerts, and school functions.

Administrators will be checking for IDs at home basketball and soccer games, concerts, plays, etc. We appreciate all parents and students adhering to our safety measures.

Thank you and Go Hawks!
ROISD Communications
text:
Hey Hawks,

Red Oak ISD values the safety and security of all students, staff, and guests at all our events.

In light of recent issues, this is a reminder that all Red Oak ISD students must have their ID on and visible at all sporting events, concerts, and school functions.

Administrators will be checking for IDs at home basketball and soccer games, concerts, plays, etc. We appreciate all parents and students adhering to our safety measures.

Thank you and Go Hawks!
ROISD Communications

Special thanks to the NEW Medical City ER Red Oak for the awesome donation of hand sanitizers and tissues for our schools.

Also, it's a great time to remind everyone to wash your hands frequently or use hand sanitizers, cough into your elbow or arm, drink lots of fluids, take your vitamins and please - stay home if you have a fever, vomiting or diarrhea. Preventive measures can keep you healthy and keep others from getting sick.
#fluseason #healthyhawks

post_text: Our ROHS FFA Ag Mechanics competed this weekend at the FWSSR! Great job Hawks! #GRIT #HawksFFA
shared_text:
Red Oak FFA
January 20 at 8:00 AM ·

Red Oak FFA Ag Mechanics students had an awesome weekend at the Fort Worth Stock Show Ag Mechanics Project Show. Students have worked extremely hard designing and fabricating their projects to show. This weekend all of the hard work and long hours have paid off with them earning red and blue ribbons and a Reserve Division winning project and even Reserve Division Showmanship honors. Students earned lots of positive comments on their creativity and workmanship of their projects. We are extremely proud of the accomplishments of this group of hardworking young people. If you see them please congratulate them on a job well done.

post_text: Wow! Congratulations Logan! #grit
shared_text:
Red Oak FFA
January 19 at 3:31 PM ·

Congratulations to Red Oak FFA member Logan Henson. Logan participated in the Fort Worth Stock Show and Rodeo Texas M.A.D.E Scholarship Contest as a part of the Agricultural Mechanics Project Show. Logan was one of 50 participants from around the state to participate in a two part contest. Students had to take a 50 question general knowledge test over agricultural mechanics information. Upon making the final 10 students had to give a three minute presentation over the project that they constructed. Logan finished in the top five earning a $9000.00 scholarship.
text:
Wow! Congratulations Logan! #grit

Reminder - this week!
Red Oak ISD will host the Spring Safety Week from January 13-17. The safety of our students and staff is our top priority. Throughout the week, the ROISD Police Department and administration will lead campuses through multiple announced and unannounced drills. Please keep this in mind when visiting your child’s campus as the front office will be closed during certain drills. We appreciate your support of our school safety preparation.

post_text:
Red Oak High School held their annual Alumni Return Day that welcomes graduates from the Class of 2019 to return and speak with current ROHS juniors and seniors.

The alumni answered questions for students about various aspects of their college experiences i.e. scholarships, dorm life and time management.

More than 60 alumni participated in Alumni Return Day representing more than 15 different colleges and universities!

The Red Oak Dance Gallery (MS/HS dance performance) has been rescheduled for Monday, January 13 at the ROHS PAC with the previously scheduled times.

ROISD UPDATE: 2:05 p.m.
All Red Oak ISD campuses will have a normal release today and buses will run on the normal schedule. The National Weather Service indicates the majority of severe weather will be later in the afternoon for our area.

ROMS UPDATE: 12:15 p.m.
Middle School Dance Performance at the PAC is canceled for tonight. Reschedule will be sent to parents when determined.

ATHLETIC UPDATE: 11:45 a.m.
All athletic games are canceled for today.
Varsity Boys and Girls Basketball games at home have been rescheduled for tomorrow, January 11. Girls will play at noon and boys will play at 2:00 PM.
...

The district is aware of potential severe weather in the forecast and will continue to monitor weather conditions throughout the day. If there are any changes, we will communicate via social media, website, and mobile app. As always, our students' safety is our top priority!

post_text: Red Oak ISD wishes to gratefully thank our community for all your kindness this holiday season. The district attempts to fill the needs of many in our community - especially our students and families, but also the community as a whole with coat, clothing, toy, and canned food drives, adopt-a-family, our first-ever foster family festival, and more. The ROISD Family and Community Services office has assisted over 150 students this holiday season due to your generosity. We thank each of you, and wish you a Merry Christmas and Happy New Year!
text: Red Oak ISD wishes to gratefully thank our community for all your kindness this holiday season. The district attempts to fill the needs of many in our community - especially our students and families, but also the community as a whole with coat, clothing, toy, and canned food drives, adopt-a-family, our first-ever foster family festival, and more. The ROISD Family and Community Services office has assisted over 150 students this holiday season due to your generosity. We thank each of you, and wish you a Merry Christmas and Happy New Year!

post_text: The Red Oak ISD School Board recognized the Red Oak High School Varsity Football Team. The team was District, Bi-District, and Area Champions. Players earned numerous All-District awards including MVP – Coby Cavil, Offensive Player – Josh Ervin, and Coaching Staff. Seventeen players were named to First or Second Team. Four players earned Academic All-State.
text: The Red Oak ISD School Board recognized the Red Oak High School Varsity Football Team. The team was District, Bi-District, and Area Champions. Players earned numerous All-District awards including MVP – Coby Cavil, Offensive Player – Josh Ervin, and Coaching Staff. Seventeen players were named to First or Second Team. Four players earned Academic All-State.

post_text: The Red Oak ISD School Board recognized the Red Oak High School Varsity Volleyball Team. The team was District, Bi-District, Area, Regional Quarterfinal Champions. Players earned numerous All-District awards including MVP - Hailey Hunt, Blocker - Zoe Willis, Defender – Ellie Davis, and Coach – Hope Porter. Nine players earned additional All-District Team placement and nine players were named to the Academic All-District team. Seven were named to TAVC All-Academic Team, and Hailey was also named to the All-Area Third Team and is graduating early to attend Stephen F. Austin in the spring.
text: The Red Oak ISD School Board recognized the Red Oak High School Varsity Volleyball Team. The team was District, Bi-District, Area, Regional Quarterfinal Champions. Players earned numerous All-District awards including MVP - Hailey Hunt, Blocker - Zoe Willis, Defender – Ellie Davis, and Coach – Hope Porter. Nine players earned additional All-District Team placement and nine players were named to the Academic All-District team. Seven were named to TAVC All-Academic Team, and Hailey was also named to the All-Area Third Team and is graduating early to attend Stephen F. Austin in the spring.

post_text:
We are expected to have temps near or below freezing the next two mornings. While the forecast shows rain and possible sleet tomorrow morning, we do not anticipate any road concerns due to the current ground temperatures. We will have crews checking road surfaces early tomorrow to make sure they are safe.

Please make sure your students are bundled up with coats, hats, and gloves as they hop on the bus, walk or even catch a ride to school.

Be sure to check the Red Oak ISD website for our weather procedures and follow us on social media, web, and download the app to get the latest updates from your district and campuses.

https://www.redoakisd.org/weather

Thank you!

post_text:
It is with a heavy heart that we inform you of the passing of Superintendent Brenda Sanford’s mother – Mrs. Norma Corry of Canton, Texas. We would like to express our deepest sympathy to her family and offer our heartfelt condolences.

All arrangements by Hilliard Funeral Home in Canton
Visitation: Saturday, December 7 from 10-11 a.m.
Service: Saturday, December 7 at 11 a.m.
Location: Lakeside Baptist Church, 1291 Old Kaufman Rd., Canton, TX

In lieu of flowers, donations can be made to the Canton Fire Department in the name of Norma Corry. She was a passionate supporter of the Pink T-shirt Fund and Christmas for Kids campaign. Send donations to 1390 State Highway 19, Canton, TX 75103.

Please keep the family in your thoughts and prayers.

post_text:
Tough loss for the Hawks tonight. Final score: RO-14 Aledo-34. Our Varsity Hawks end this season as Area champs, Bi-District champs and undefeated District champs! We are so proud of the hard work and dedication they have put in this season.

Thank you to all the players, coaches, parents, and fans for a great season!

Thank you to all the players, coaches, parents, and fans for a great season!

Texas high school football at its best, as our Hawks keep soaring above the rest! Come out tonight and support your Red Oak Hawks Varsity Football Team as they play the Aledo Bearcats at 7:00 PM at AT&T Stadium in the Regional Semifinal round of the 5A Division 2 UIL Football Playoffs. We are the visiting team.

We need all of our Hawk fans to come out and pack the stands! Don’t forget your rally towels and your school spirit. #LetsGoHawks

Tickets:
Presale - $12 online at SeatGeek (https://seatgeek.com/2019-texas-hs-football-playoffs-tickets/football/2019-11-29-12-pm/5129674?fbclid=IwAR3VVC8ZZTzXSV8j2-wVusKUpeCmkA5G5nbZyg4veIVW8Fe1DDNrhLeKL8g)
Game Day - $15 at AT&T Stadium
Children 1 year of age and up must have a ticket.

Current THSCA pass is valid for 1 admission, no district admin or ISD employee passes will be accepted.

Parking:
$10 per car if you pay with credit
$15 per car if you pay with cash

Can't make it to the game? Listen at http://sportsgram.net/schedule.php.

post_text:
In Red Oak ISD, we believe that our partnership with parents is one of the hallmarks of student success. That is why we have dedicated the evening of Nov. 21 and the morning of Nov. 22 to have focused and in-depth parent-teacher conferences. If another time is preferred, please contact your child's teacher(s) for options.

Elementary parents - please schedule an appointment with your teacher; Secondary parents - the format is more open house allowing you to drop-in when it is convenient.

post_text:
Congratulations to our Hawk Volleyball signee Hailey Hunt who committed to Stephen F. Austin State University today!

“Hailey has jumped in and taken on leadership roles, starting six years ago when she joined our volleyball program in middle school,” stated Head Coach Hope Porter. “There will be a big void in our program when she is gone. But before that, we have more work to do.”

The Lady Hawks will play Lovejoy HS in the Regional Semifinals on Friday, November 15 at 7 p.m. at Berkner High School in Richardson.

#roisdnewjourney #grit

post_text:
Join us for the annual Brookshire's Community Pep Rally TONIGHT, November 6! This event will begin at 7:45 PM, with doors opening at 7:15 PM. The ROHS winter sport athletes will be honored with performances by the ROHS Hawkettes, Cheer, and Step Team!

Come enjoy a special basketball game between your Hawk and Lady Hawk basketball teams vs. the Red Oak High School Faculty All-Stars. We will welcome Olympic Gold Medalist and Red Oak Alumni Michelle Carter along with former SMU wide receiver and Red Oak Alumni Jeremiah Gaines as celebrity coaches!

FREE shirts for the first 100 students with a ROISD ID!
Brookshire's will sell hot dogs and drinks starting at 7:15 PM while they last.

Red Oak ISD hosted a Dyslexia Parent Information Night last night with all district dyslexia staff on hand as well as guest speaker Leroy McClure, author of 'Why Sammy Still Can't Read.' For more information on parent enrichment classes, visit the website at www.redoakisd.org

post_text:
Hawks support Dallas ISD!

Our football rivals, the Thomas Jefferson High School Patriots, and neighboring school Walnut Hill Elementary were hit by the recent tornado and need our assistance. Red Oak ISD received tremendous community support after the tornado hit Shields, and this is our opportunity to pay it forward.

All Red Oak ISD students and staff can participate in a campus FREE Dress Day for a $5 donation to the cause! (Day to be designated by the campus principal.) All Red Oak ISD campuses and the administration building will be accepting monetary donations through next Friday, November 1.

Please keep the Dallas ISD staff and students in your thoughts and prayers during this time.
Thank you in advance for your Hawk support of Dallas ISD staff and students!

post_text: Ticket information for Friday nights game!
shared_text:
Red Oak Hawks Football
October 21, 2019 at 2:38 PM ·

Football tickets for the Friday, October 25 varsity football game against Dallas Conrad at Goodloe Stadium are on sale now in the Red Oak ISD athletic office from 8 - 4 PM.

Tickets will also be sold at Red Oak High School during the lunch periods (12:00 PM to 1:30 PM) on Thursday and Friday in the Hawks Nest.

Pre-game ticket prices will be $6.00 for adult general admission and $4.00 for student general admission.

All general admission tickets at the game will be $6.00.

All Reserved seating tickets will be $8.00.

Please see Tammy Howard, ROISD athletic secretary, to purchase tickets for the football game.

post_text: Great job FFA!
shared_text:
Red Oak FFA
October 15, 2019 at 10:10 PM ·

Congratulations to Red Oak FFA Ag Mechanic students who participated at the State Fair of Texas Agricultural Mechanics Project Show. All students did a great job exhibiting their projects earning two blue and one red ribbon!! Jaylon Johnson placed 3rd in a tough class of livestock feeding equipment with his Calf Creep Feeder. Students have been working super hard this year and are ready to get back to work on our next set of projects that will premier at the late winter/spring major shows. Great job guys!
text:
Great job FFA!

Red Oak FFA
October 15, 2019 at 10:10 PM ·

Congratulations to Red Oak FFA Ag Mechanic students who participated at the State Fair of Texas Agricultural Mechanics Project Show. All students did a great job exhibiting their projects earning two blue and one red ribbon!! Jaylon Johnson placed 3rd in a tough class of livestock feeding equipment with his Calf Creep Feeder. Students have been working super hard this year and are ready to get back to work on our next set of projects that will premier at the late winter/spring major shows. Great job guys!

post_text: Important information about tonight's RO Football game!
shared_text:
Red Oak Hawks Football
October 11, 2019 at 10:14 AM ·

IMPORTANT INFORMATION: Dallas ISD Stadiums Clear Bag Policy

Each ticketed person is permitted the following into ticketed events:

The following items are not allowed:

Clear tote - plastic, vinyl or PVC bags that do not exceed 12" x 6" x 12"
Plastic storage bag - Clear one (1) gallon, re-sealable
Small clutch size - approximately the size of a hand with or without a handle or strap. No larger than 6.5" and 4.5" with or without a handle or strap
An exception will be made for medically necessary items after proper inspection.
Prohibited bags

Prohibited items include, but are not limited to:

All purses, bags or containers larger than a small clutch
Backpacks
Briefcases
Camera Bags
Fanny Packs
Computer Bags
Coolers
Luggage of any kind
Diaper Bags
Drawstring Bags

https://www.dallasisd.org/site/default.aspx?PageType=3&DomainID=663&ModuleInstanceID=5616&ViewID=6446EE88-D30C-497E-9316-3F8874B3E108&RenderLoc=0&FlexDataID=137531&PageID=2594

post_text:
Hawktoberfest is TOMORROW - Saturday, October 12 - from 8:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. at Red Oak HS! We are looking forward to a great time. You don't want to miss this great family fun event that benefits our schools' PTAs!

Fun 1 Mile Run onsite registration starts at 8:30 a.m. and the run starts at 9 a.m. Then enjoy donuts, Chick-fil-A breakfast bites and sandwiches, pancakes-on-a-stick, fried pickles, funnel cakes, corn dogs, and more while playing awesome games and checking out our student performances!

Grab your family and friends and join us this Saturday!

post_text:
Did you know your student is eligible to win a bike or gift card each six weeks they have perfect attendance? Each elementary school has two bikes to give away every six weeks, and secondary schools have gift cards to reward students with perfect attendance. At the end of the year, students can win a Chrome Book computer!!

We love to see our students every day! Of course, emergencies happen, and please don't send your child if they have a fever or other illness symptoms. Students must be fever-free without medicine for 24-hrs. before they can return to school.

We wish to thank our 2019-20 sponsors of the iCount Program supporting students with perfect attendance: Cooper Insures, Walmart Red Oak, and the ROISD Education Foundation.

post_text: Congratulations to the Red Oak ISD Purchasing Department for earning a TASBO - Purchasing Award of Merit. The Award of Merit recognizes the achievements of educational organizations in implementing best practices in the area of purchasing. The honorees demonstrate professional purchasing operations and share their best practices in policies and procedures with colleagues throughout the state. Purchasing Agent Julie Phillips and Business Services Assistant Yvonne Cook, along with CFO Bill Johnston, will be honored at the TASBO Annual Conference in March 2020.

The City of Red Oak Office of Emergency Management will be conducting the monthly outdoor warning siren TEST today at 2:00 P.M. This test is to ensure that all sirens in the city are in working order.

This test is conducted on the first Wednesday of every month, weather permitting.

post_text:
On Monday, September 30, the Red Oak ISD School Board selected Brenda Sanford as the lone finalist for the position of Superintendent for Red Oak ISD. She is currently the Director of Curriculum and Assessment for Canton ISD.

The Board is expected to officially hire Mrs. Sanford on Monday, October 21, after the mandatory 21-day waiting period.

https://bit.ly/2od6ykN

post_text: Great Red Oak Alumni in history!
shared_text:
Texas Woman's Pioneers
September 30, 2018 at 12:40 PM ·

THIS DATE IN HISTORY: Thirty years ago today, TWU Hall of Famer Louise Ritter won the High Jump gold medal in Seoul, South Korea during the Summer Olympics in what is considered one of the Games' major upsets. The world's attention was focused on Ritter, a three-time Olympic qualifier, as she set an Olympic record and tied her American record with a jump of 6-feet-8-inches. Ritter defeated the reigning world champion Stefka Kostadinova in a jump-off and won the United States a gold medal in women's high jump for the first time since 1956. We celebrate this anniversary with Louise, who is also a 1989 TWU Distinguished Alumna! Texas Woman's University Louise Ritter

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WjPCk6o13_w

Come out to Chipotle in Red Oak this evening between 5-9pm for dinner and 33% of your purchase price will go to the Red Oak High Swim Team! Let’s help the team raise money for much needed equipment!

Make sure to show or mention the attached flyer so they get credit for your purchase. And please share and spread the word!

Thank you so much for your support for this great group of kids.

post_text: Ticket information for the Homecoming football game this Friday, October 4.
shared_text:
Red Oak Hawks Football
September 30, 2019 at 3:12 PM ·

Varsity Football Tickets for Red Oak ISD Homecoming

Football tickets for the Friday, October 4 varsity football game against Thomas Jefferson at Goodloe Stadium are on sale now in the Red Oak ISD athletic office from 8 AM - 4 PM.

Tickets will also be sold at Red Oak High School during all lunch periods (12 PM - 1:30 PM) on Thursday and Friday in the Hawks Nest.

Pre-game ticket prices will be $6.00 for adult general admission and $4.00 for student general admission.

All general admission tickets at the game will be $6.00.

All Reserved seating tickets will be $8.00.

Please see Tammy Howard, ROISD athletic secretary, to purchase tickets for the football game.

post_text:
Celebrating the end of the first six weeks, Red Oak ISD Human Resources and Curriculum staff visited new teachers across the district to deliver an extra ‘Payday’ candy bar and see how things are going.

We want to make sure our classroom teachers are supported both as educators and as employees. The first year teaching, or in a new district, can be challenging, so we make sure they know who to reach out to or contact for help!

post_text:
Elected in 2016 as a Texas Supreme Court Judge in the Texas Court of Criminal Appeals, Judge Scott Walker was selected as the 2019 ROHS Distinguished Alumni by the ROHS Alumni Association and will be honored at the October 4th homecoming celebrations. Scott Walker graduated from Red Oak High School in 1971.

Red Oak ISD and the Alumni Association will honor Judge Walker as grand marshall for the 2019 Homecoming Parade at 2 p.m. on Friday, October 4. The Alumni Association will host a reception at 5:30 p.m. at Red Oak Middle School, and then the group will attend the Hawks football game that evening at 7:30 p.m. and Judge Walker will be honored at halftime.

All alumni interested in joining the festivities should contact Laura Kelly at laura.kelly@redoakisd.org.

https://www.redoakisd.org/page/1927
